page.title: 11Transport continued
page.content: into a race track during the rush hour. The council plan that the new road will be landscaped with native trees, so hopefully the wild plants and wildlife will return. This work is due to be completed at end of 1986. Smaller road to south runs 4 miles from Roffey to Pease Potage where it joins A23 south to Brighton and M23/A23 north to Crawley, Gatwick Airport, and London 30 odd miles away. This attractive road through northern edge of St Leondards Forest is like a green tunnel in spring and summer with trees meeting overhead for most of its length. The village of Colgate is halfway along. Due to the road works on A264 a great deal more traffic charges through the village ignoring the 40mph speed limit.
